fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40537].
  {panel}

We have a local Confluence instance and experienced a very "hostile" limitation of fundamental functionality in the system after exceeding the 250 user limit that our license includes. 

After we exceeded the limit to 255 users the functions to save a page (either after creating a pager or editing a page) were disabled for all current users and the attached error appeared.

I find this a very drastic consequence with a very negative affect towards the customer experience - instead of just throwing an error if user no. 251 is being created. 

Hope you can find a more graceful solution to this.

Brgds.
Sigurdur
fields.summary: Limited functionality for users after exceeding the user license limit

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40536].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
*com.atlassian.bonnie.search.extractor.ExtractorException* occurred when we build search index on Word files which passwords are set on.
I understand that it is not possible to create search index on contents in a Word files which passwords are set on, however, I think the exception should be handled correctly.
Could you suppress the exception with handling it correctly?

h3. Environments
* Confluence 5.8.x
* Confluence 5.9.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach  [^test_password.docx] (the password is 'test') to a page in Confluence
# Rebuild index
# Check *atlassian-confluence.log*

h3. Expected Results
No exception occurred.

Disabling *Word XML Content Extractor* worked to suppress the exception.
However, as you know, it will miss some functions about indexing on Word files.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40527].
  {panel}

When editing a Confluence page, the shortcuts that are used elsewhere on the system no longer work. Please add an editing mode that respects system keyboard shortcuts.

This is not the same as wanting to configure custom shortcuts as requested in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-23940
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-26156

Rather, it is a matter of using the existing keyboard shortcuts but having them work in Confluence as they do elsewhere.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40526].
  {panel}

When attempting to delete a comment on an image attached to a page, sometimes the menu containing the delete option disappears, and I am unable to delete the comment.

See attachment, its the menu in the top right, opened by clicking the elipsis on the comment.

To reproduce:
- Create a new page
- Attach an image
- Add an inline comment to the image
- Refresh the page
- Click the image, open comments
- On the comment, click the elipsis menu several times  - you will notice flickering.
fields.summary: Elipsis menu for inline comments on page attachments flickers and occasionally disappears when trying to delete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40522].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is only possible to [sort/display tasks by the label on the page where the task resides|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Task+Report+Macro] but pages could potentially contain a mixture of tasks that should be labeled differently.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would increase the functionality of task features exponentially if there was the ability to add a tag/label to each individual task, similarly to the way the @mention can be added to any task that has a checkbox in front of it. This would enable customers  to sort/filter tasks (ie - in a task report macro) by those tags.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Ability to add labels to individual Tasks and sort by Task labels in the Task Report Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40499].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When nesting a macro within a Page Properties the Page Properties report macro will not populate the macro content.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start with a JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance.
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
# Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
# Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains a JIRA Issues Macro that will return some number of issues from JIRA.
# View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results

The page properties for the space will populate in the page properties report. 

h3. Actual Results

In two cases I tested it in using the Contributor Macro and Jira issues filter  JIRA issues it will just hang on "Getting issues". On the contributors macro it doesn't render and returns an odd result: {"contextEntityId":12222521} although in preview "mode" it works expected.
fields.summary: Page properties report broken when using nested macros.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40493].
  {panel}

Existing System Properties:
* atlassian.indexing.contentbody.maxsize - configures the max size to index for all attachments
* officeconnector.spreadsheet.xlsxmaxsize - does the same for Excel files
* officeconnector.textextract.word.docxmaxsize - works for Word files

I'm requesting that we add a property for PDF files specifically as indexing of PDF files has specific performance concerns that could be tuned directly with an attribute for that file type alone.
fields.summary: Add a system property for a max index size for PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently if public access is disabled however there are permissions specified for public access any authenticated users will inherit those permissions. 

h3. Suggested Solution
 
When public access is disabled the permissions should revert to default (which is none). 

h3. Workaround 

When public access is disabled globally.  if you had previously specified permissions make sure to remove permissions specified on the public access level in space permissions as well.
fields.summary: If public is disabled  public access space permissions should bet set to default.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40485].
  {panel}

In Confluence, we have a special user group which contains only external users (i. e. users outside our company).
Users of this group should not be able to access the People Directory, because it gives them a list of all internal users (i. e. employees of our company).
We found a way to hide the "People" button in the top menu by adding a script to the Main Site Layout.
However, if the user goes to his own profile, there is another "People" link above the user name. Which leads the user back to the people directory and there's no way to hide the link.

Of course it would be even better to completely restrict access to the browsepeople.action page for certain user groups.
fields.summary: Restrict access to People Directory for certain user groups
Be able to choose the User Directory when adding a new user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40478].
  {panel}

Currently, tasks are very one dimensional. They exist inline, and are displayed in a table or task report macro.

However, it'd be nice to create and assign tasks on a page without having to assign the owner and due date inline - perhaps from a dedicated UI?

A status field would also be very helpful for storing information about the task itself, without necessarily going into the task body.

While it sounds like these might be more suited to JIRA, there are also scenarios where customers would like to present clients a list of outstanding tasks (without them having access to the underlying JIRA)
fields.summary: Make tasks first class citizens in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40477].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is not currently integration between Confluence and HipChat that allows for users in HipChat to select certain data or chat messages and relay it to a specific Confluence page. The purpose of this functionality would be to allow for important information shared through HipChat to be archived in a central location (a Confluence page) where users can view important information and leave comments/inline comments. Copied chats would include the date/time stamp as well as the sender.

h3. Suggested Solutions
* Include an option to highlight text in HipChat, or select a message in HipChat and send to a specific Confluence page.
** A more integrated/advanced version of having better copy/paste features between HC and Confluence: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25753
* Allow auto archiving of all chats in a HipChat room to a corresponding Confluence Page
* Create a tag, and use the predetermined hashtags in HipChat messages to designate which HipChat messages should move to which Confluence page
fields.summary: Send selected HipChat messages to a Confluence Page for archiving

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40469].
  {panel}

h4. Symptoms
- Certain pages with macros do not render on time, the page times out
- The following or similar stack trace appears in the logs: {code}2016-01-08 09:15:55,846 ERROR [ajp-nio-8009-exec-3] [adaptavist.analytics.common.GoogleAnalyticsService] sendDataToAnalytics Unable to send analytics data to google service!
 -- referer: http://base.url/path | url: /path | userName: admin | action: viewpage | page: 12345678

        at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.tryConnect(DefaultRequestDirector.java:611)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.execute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:446)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.doExecute(AbstractHttpClient.java:882)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:82)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:107)
        at org.apache.http.impl.client.CloseableHttpClient.execute(CloseableHttpClient.java:55)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.common.GoogleAnalyticsService.sendDataToAnalytics(GoogleAnalyticsService.java:69)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.common.GoogleAnalyticsService.sendDataToAnalytics(GoogleAnalyticsService.java:47)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:37)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
        at com.adaptavist.analytics.macrosusage.AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.execute(AbstractAnalyticsLegacyMacro.java:32)
        at com.adaptavist.confluence.contentformatting.ContentFormattingMacro.renderMacro(ContentFormattingMacro.java:49)
...
{code}

h4. Environment
- Adaptavist Content Formatting Macros version 4.2.13-4.2.15 is installed

h4. Problem
This is an issue with the mentioned third-party add-on. The problem is caused by the add-on gathering Google Analytics data and tries to send it. If this fails for any reason (network error for example), the macro rendering may take longer than the page rendering timeout.

h4. Workaround
Downgrade to any version of the plugin prior to 4.2.13.

h4. Solution
If you have an active support license with Adaptavist, you can track this issue with reference {{CONTENTF-251}}. Wait for the bug to be fixed and install the plugin version that contains it.
*Update:* The issue was reportedly fixed in version 4.2.16 of the plugin.
fields.summary: Some macros/pages fail to render with Content Formatting Macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40468].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
*Edit in Office* feature returns permission error when trying to upload documents in IE 11

h3. Environment
* Confluence {{6.0.0-OD-2016.02.1-0006}}
* Internet Explorer 11 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert and Ms Office file as attachment using the *Office*
# Save
# Go to {{...}} at the top left > Attachments
# Choose _Edit in Office_ beside the attachment you want edit.
Your browser will ask you to confirm that you want to open the file. 
# Choose OK. 
You may also see a security warning or be asked to log in to your Confluence server - enter your Confluence username and password, then choose OK.
# The file will open in your Office application.
# Make your changes.
# Save the document. 

h3. Expected Results
Attachment file is saved back to Confluence

h3. Actual Results
This error is returned:
{noformat}
Upload Failed: Permission Issue

We saved your changes, but we couldn't verify that you have the necessary permissions to upload the file. Check your permissions with the document owner or click Resolve for more options.
{noformat}

* Clicking _Resolve_ pops up a window to enter authentication, however doesn't resolve the issue.

h3. Notes
* These steps should work as it follows the documentation mentioned here:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/edit-office-files-724765124.html
* This happens even if the user has sufficient permission to view/edit the attachments. 

h3.Workaround
* Download the file, edit and upload new version to the Confluence page manually.
fields.summary: Edit in Office feature returns permission error when trying to upload documents in IE 11
Show related pages in Attachment Properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40466].
  {panel}

Edited page should trigger the [notification feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Managing+Notifications+in+Confluence] as well instead of just the following event:

{quote}
The workbox displays a notification when someone does one of the following in Confluence:

* [Shares|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Emailing+a+Page] a page or blog post with you.
* [Mentions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Using+Mentions] you in a page, blog post or comment.
* Comments on a page or blog post that you are [watching|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Watching+a+Page+or+Blog+Post].
* [Likes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF43/Likes+and+Popular+Content] a page or blog post that you are watching.
The workbox does not show notifications triggered because you are watching a space. Only watches on pages and blog posts are relevant here.{quote}

By allowing page edition to be included into the notification feature, Confluence could discard e-mail notification altogether and rely on the notification feature. This will make working with Confluence completely independent of email system if i want to keep track of changes of pages i care about.
This would also solve the digestion mail issue (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-14485), due to many small updates (which i think should be encouraged), because you will be able to simply replace the notification already created, regarding editting of page, with a new one, which is difficult to do with email. It should of course be optional to recieve notification on this, as it should be optional to recieve notifications about likes.

If you ask me, email notifications should just be an extra option on all the different types of notifications you want in your WorkBox. Maybe WorkBox should be split into a "Work"-box with things that require some action or has high attention like mentions, comments to things i have written, or changes to jira elements i am assigned to. low attentions notificaiton could be updates to pages/spaces i am watching and likes of comments or pages.
fields.summary: Watched Edited Page should trigger notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40462].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a table of contents with the TOC Macro on a page, you can click on the anchor and it takes you to the respective section on the page. Once in that section, you can click the  "Back" button in the browser window and be taken back to the table of contents. If you are affected by this bug, you are not automatically redirect back when clicking "Back."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert Table of Contents Macro
# Create headers for each section
# Add content to each section so that scrolling is necessary to arrive at sections
# View page and click on an item in the table of contents
# Once on that section of the page, click "Back" in your browser window.

h3. Expected Results
You should be returned to the table of contents.

h3. Actual Results
Page remains in current section.
 
h3.Workaround
# Insert a new macro: Table of Content Zone
# Drag your original table of content macro icon into the new Table of Content Zone
# Click "Save"
fields.summary: Table of contents macro does not respond to browser's "Back" button

h3. Summary

When a table contains a combination of numbers and letters, sorting does not properly alphabetize the columns.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table with the following data:
||Column 1||Column 2||
|a|abc|
|b|aab|
|3|acb|
|abc|bbc|
|jha|bac|
|2bcd|bbb|
|1zja|bca|
|aaks|bcb|
# Save table
# Click Column 1 to sort

h3. Expected Results

The table will be sorted in correct alphabetical order. 

h3. Actual Results

Table is sorted as follows (Column 1):

1	
1zja	
2	
2bcd	
3	
abc	
jha	
aaks	

Notice jha is between abc and aaks. I would expect it would sort aaks, abc, jha. 

h3. Notes
See screenshot attached. 

h3.Workaround
No workaround available.
fields.summary: Tables are sorted incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40459].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Customer generates a backup from Cloud and tries to import into an OD release, but it fails. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
* Import a backup from Cloud to a Confluence 6.0.0-OD _(Cog Icon > General Configuration > Backup and Restore)_, it doesn't matter if it's in a brand new instance or the current one.

h3. Expected Results:
* Import is successful

h3. Actual Results:
* Import fails with the following stack-trace relating to a certain _jobRunnerKey_:

{code}
2016-01-14 14:51:51,767 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.xmlimport.DefaultImportProcessor] persist Error while saving object: Imported[com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium.SchedulerClusteredJob] [Id[id]=26181634, Property[jobId]=com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerManager.5308417, Property[nextRunTime]=2016-01-13 17:40:53.202, Property[version]=236, Property[jobRunnerKey]=com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerManager, Property[rawParameters]=java.io.BufferedInputStream@15d47d4, Property[schedType]=I, Property[cronExpression]=, Property[cronTimeZone]=, Property[intervalFirstRunTime]=2016-01-04 01:33:48.884, Property[intervalMillis]=3600000]
 -- referer: http://localhost:8600/confluence/admin/restore-local-file.action | url: /confluence/longrunningtaskxml.action | traceId: 7055808d4953e33d | userName: admin | action: longrunningtaskxml 
{code}

h3. Root Cause
There's a cronjob that's causing the issue here:
{code}
<object class="SchedulerClusteredJob" package="com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium">
<id name="id">26181634</id>
<property name="jobId"><![CDATA[com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerManager.5308417]]></property>
<property name="nextRunTime">2016-01-13 17:40:53.202</property>
<property name="version">236</property>
<property name="jobRunnerKey"><![CDATA[com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerManager]]></property>
<property name="rawParameters">java.io.BufferedInputStream@15d47d4</property>
<property name="schedType">I</property>
<property name="cronExpression"/><property name="cronTimeZone"/><property name="intervalFirstRunTime">2016-01-04 01:33:48.884</property>
<property name="intervalMillis">3600000</property>
</object>
{code}

h3. Workaround

Remove the problematic cronjob(s) from {{entities.xml}}:

# Extract the files from the backup archive, and open {{entities.xml}}
# Search {{entities.xml}} for objects with jobRunnerKey *com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerManager* and remove them (from <object> to </object>.
# Zip up all files that were extracted from the backup, taking care not to include the enclosing folder (as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/XML+backup+restore+failed+with+'The+zip+file+did+not+contain+an+entry+'exportDescriptor.properties''+in+Confluence])
# Import the new backup archive into a fresh Confluence instance
fields.summary: Restore a backup from Cloud fails with Illegal base64 character 2e

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40457].
  {panel}

h5. Suggestion
The [XML-RPC and SOAP APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-rest-api/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis] used to have an {{exportSpace}} functionality, however they are deprecated since Confluence 5.5. The [REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-rest-api] functionality does not include an option for creating space/site exports. Even if the exported XML is not transferred via the REST interface, the action could trigger the backup of any given space or the instance to the export directory, optionally providing a download link for it

h5. Workaround 
The [Confluence CLI|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.cli/cloud/overview] provides such functionality, but it is a paid third-party add-on. The above functionality would be important to automate migration/backup tasks for administrators.

h3. Problem Definition

Customer migrates large confluence server instance to cloud. Currently for confluence there is a 200MB uncompressed XML limit. For larger customers even if they break down the backup into space exports. There space exports can exceed that size pretty easily. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a method for larger customers to migrate large XML imports into Cloud. 
 
h3. Workaround 

- Reduce space size by curating and archiving older data into backups to meet compliance needs.
- Break down larger spaces into smaller spaces that meet the ~200MB size limit for imports.
fields.summary: Increase size limit for imports for bigger customers migrating from server to cloud.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40425].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
The current [documentation for SQL server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-sql-server-9258.html] does not specify the SQL server dialect that should be used. Older versions of Confluence with {{net.sf.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerDialect}}, but that by default will create columns with {{varchar}} instead of {{nvarchar}}. 

h4. Suggestion
Latest versions of Confluence will fail with the incorrect column type. The supported dialect is {{net.sf.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerIntlDialect}}. This should be mentioned in upgrade documentation for MSSQL and also the MSSQL specific documentation above.

h4. References
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-18903
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+upgrade+fails+because+SQL+Server+could+not+complete+schema+update
fields.summary: Documentation request: Specify the supported SQL Server dialect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40419].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently there isn't a streamlined way to apply permissions to a collection of spaces to user groups.

You can manage global permissions to a degree and you could manage individual space permissions. 

What's more you have to micro manage page restrictions if you only want users to edit particular pages. Child pages do not inherit permissions recursively from parent permissions. This creates a head ache for the use case if you have parent pages that have thousands of child pages different restriction requirements. You essentially would have to make each Parent page a space to meet the requirement. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide method similar to Permission schemes in JIRA for Projects for Spaces in Confluence that fits the permission structure spaces and pages.
fields.summary: Ability to have Space Permission schemes and recursive parent page restrictions.

h3. Notes

It seems during the draft there isn't enough time perform the copy>draft>conversion before the saving action is complete. 

h3.Workaround

If you wait a moment it will eventually save. Also you could potentially copy and save it to another space and move the copy back into the original source space.
fields.summary: "Saving is not possible at the moment" when copying a page with alot of attachments within the same space.
Roadmap Planner Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40414].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes cached authentication data in Confluence prevents users from seeing updated changes (such as group memberships). To resolve this, users will need to log out, clear their cookies, and log back in.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an 'Expire all cookies' task that can be run by users in the scheduled jobs. There is already a task that does this for expired RememberMe tokens.

h3. Workaround 
Please follow these steps to expire all cookies in Confluence:
(!) Shutdown Confluence and backup your database before making any of these changes.
# Run the following on your database. This will set the 'created' date for the cookies to 11/01/2015 (in epoch time):
{code:sql}
UPDATE remembermetoken SET created = 1446337357;
{code}
# Go to !http://i.imgur.com/jGuDYP2.png! -> cache management -> flush all
# Go to !http://i.imgur.com/jGuDYP2.png! -> General configuration -> scheduled jobs -> Clear Expired Remember Me Tokens -> Run
# Restart Confluence
(!) If you've set the rememberMe token expiration higher, you will need to create a new date using epoch time that exceeds that period.
fields.summary: Expire all cookies functionality

h3. Summary
Timestamps are wrong for recently *Recently Worked on*. The recent changes are showing as yesterday.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Check the *Recently worked on*.

h3. Expected Results
It should be showing as *Today*.

h3. Actual Results
It will show as *yesterday*.
fields.summary: Timestamps are wrong for recently worked on and recently visited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40386].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attempting to add certain users to Team Calendar Events or sharing items with these users will redirect you to their User Profile instead.
This bug occurs when a user's avatar has spaces in its filename. This happens because we attempt to construct a java.net.URI from the path to the user's avatar without percent-encoding first - the space character is not permitted in a URI.
Affected users have a grey avatar icon instead of their own uploaded avatar.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.02.1-0006
* Team Calendar 5.3.10-D20151229T094001

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the share dialog on a page, or a calendar event
2. Type an affected user's name in the autocomplete field
3. In the autocomplete results observe that the user's avatar is not present, but is a grey person outline instead
4. Clicking on the result to add it the share dialog navigates to the profile page instead (hence losing the content that was typed in the share dialog) and the console shows a JS error originating from {{Confluence.Templates.Share.Dialog.recipientUser}} - when pausing on the error you can see that $thumbnailLink is undefined

!share profile.png!
h3. Workaround
Affected users will need to upload a new profile picture which does not have any spaces in the filename.
fields.summary: Can't share page with specific users, or add them to Calendar events (thumbnailLink is undefined, leading to JS error)
Velocity Context Module incomplete or outdated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40378].
  {panel}

Currently, Confluence allows you to disable signups entirely, have completely unrestricted signups (from any domain), or specify a list of email domains that are allowed to sign up - in which case an email with a token is sent to the user to verify they own the email address.

As an open source project, we need to have unrestricted public signups to Confluence (and JIRA) - we want people to get involved, and we can't know what email domains they are going to use (it could be a personal email address, or one associated with their employment).

These unrestricted sign ups are also completely unverified - as a result, and even with the (poor) captcha implementation in place, we are getting hit by automated signups to our public Confluence (and JIRA), and getting spam content and comments getting added to the sites.

If the email addresses were verified to be real by sending an email with a verification token before login was allowed, then this would greatly assist in reducing spam.

I would like to see the existing email account verification that is present when restricting to a domain to be available as an option for the "unrestricted signups" - so that people can register using any email domain, but they can not affect the content until they verify their email address.

This should apply to possible signups through JIRA as well as Confluence.
fields.summary: Enable email confirmation for all signups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40365].
  {panel}

Currently only 4 gadgets are bundled in Confluence:


* *Activity Stream*: Lists recent activity in a single project, or in all projects.
* *Confluence Page Gadget*: This gadget renders a Confluence Page.
* *Confluence QuickNav*: This gadget allows you to embed the Confluence QuickNav into other applications.
* *Confluence News*: News about Confluence.

An additional gadget which shows the page directory for Confluence spaces should be bundled in Confluence. The gadget would be useful for JIRA users to see a page directory from their JIRA dashboards.
fields.summary: Bundle page directory gadget in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40349].
  {panel}

When trying to import Word documents with hyperlinks similar to macro definitions Confluence fails to import them and the following error is thrown:
{code}
com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.InternalServerException: com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.migration.exceptions.UnknownMacroMigrationException: The macro '394jsg-75ty-4825-lk65k-cfg456jmka' is unknown.
    at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.processMigrationResult(ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.java:320)
caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.migration.exceptions.UnknownMacroMigrationException: The macro '394jsg-75ty-4825-lk65k-cfg456jmka' is unknown.
    at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.migration.XhtmlMacroRendererComponent$MacroHandler.handleMacro(XhtmlMacroRendererComponent.java:91)
{code}
{code}
com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.InternalServerException: com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.migration.exceptions.UnknownMacroMigrationException: The macro '394jsg-75ty-4825-lk65k-cfg456jmka' is unknown.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.processMigrationResult(ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.java:320)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.computeConvertedValue(ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.java:229)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.lambda$convert$33(ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.java:128)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ThreadlocalWebResourceDependenciesRecorder.record(ThreadlocalWebResourceDependenciesRecorder.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.convert(ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.service.content.ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.convert(ContentBodyConversionServiceImpl.java:114)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor3074.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.procee
{code}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a .doc Word file having a hyperlink with a similar target:
{code}
anything:anythingelse={394JSG-75TY-4825-LK65K-CFG456JMKA}
{code}
# Use the *Import Word Document* functionality from any page
# Select any options on it.
# Complete the import.

*Expected results*
The page should be imported on Confluence with a link on it.

*Actual results*
Confluence throws an error on screen stating that an unknown macro is missing with the same id as described in the Hyperlink target: 394JSG-75TY-4825-LK65K-CFG456JMKA

Hello, 

At the moment we would find useful the possibility to keep track of all spaces/pages where an user has been mentioned. Also there should be some sort of filtering in place for this (i.e. seeing mentions from only a certain period of time, or from only a certain space etc.)

This feature will help users which are being mentioned in multiple spaces keep a better track of information that might be of relevance rather than scrolling through notification emails. 

Best regards!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40316].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open the Keyboard Shortcuts dialog (menu: Help > Keyboard Shortcuts).
2. Uncheck "Enable General Shortcuts"
3. Close the dialog.
4. Go view any page that you are allowed to edit and/or can comment on.
5. Press "e" (the edit shortcut) or "m" (comment)

Expected results:
* Nothing. The shortcuts should be disabled.

Actual results:
* If you pressed "e": The edit action is triggered and you are redirected to the Edit screen for the page you were viewing.
* If you pressed "m": The page jumps down to the comment box.

I haven't checked all of the shortcuts. There may be others that also aren't disabled. This issue also blocks the usage of some accessibility softwares, as those applications also use general shortcuts that are overwritten by the ones in Confluence.

*Reporter*: Lachlan Hunt
*E-mail*: [mailto:lhunt@atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Disabling General Shortcuts doesn't disable all of them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40313].
  {panel}

h2.Description

When performing a single page XML export (not the entire Space, just a single page), if there are any Blogs in that Space, the Blogs get exported in addition to the page you are trying to export. If there are attachments in these Blogs, those also get exported. 

h2.Suggestion

It should be possible to opt out of exporting all Blogs when trying to export a single page. In some cases, there may be dozens of Blogs and many gigabytes of attachments. Instead of getting a small file with the single page export, you can end up with a massive, multi-gigabyte export.

h2.Steps to reproduce

1. Perform an XML export of a single page in a Space that has Blogs with attachments.
2. Download the exported page export and then import into a different Confluence instance and observe that the page is imported along with all Blogs in the space as well as the attachments.
fields.summary: Single page XML export should not export blogs and their attachments

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-40307].
  {panel}

Comments on files have a date, everywhere else in Confluence where the date of a piece of content is displayed, that date is also a permalink to the item in question. This is not true for file viewer comments.

Reproduce:
* Create a page with an image.
* View the page.
* Click on the image.
* Make a comment on said image.
* View this comment in the image viewer modal thingy.
* Note that the date is not a link.
fields.summary: File viewer comments date display should be a permalink to the comment
